data.description:
RUNNER features visceral first-person arcade driving combat that embraces the unique visual style of late 1980’s prestige anime. Featuring high-speed combat, intense encounters and an incredible throwback soundtrack.

When there's nowhere left to hide, the only way out is through.

⁍ Freeform 360-degree VR shooting
⁍ Blisteringly fast motorcycle combat with full maneuvering control
⁍ Unlockable bikes with unique attributes and abilities
⁍ Intuitive gameplay with upgradeable sidearm mods
⁍ Combine mounted gun upgrades to create unique weapons
⁍ Utilize missiles and grenades as part of your arsenal
⁍ Deflect incoming fire with the energy saber
⁍ Execute time-bending special moves with R.U.S.H. mode
⁍ 7 massive levels unique to every playthrough
⁍ 3 Additional bonus stages now available, with more to come
⁍ Revisit stages at your leisure with the Level Select +
⁍ Try 'Cruising' mode: just you, the music, and the road
⁍ High-speed encounters with varied enemy types
⁍ Chain together combos for massive scores
⁍ Enormous and intense boss encounters
⁍ Fully-voiced narrative single-player experience
⁍ Featuring the voices of Steve Blum, Sandra Saad and Richard Epcar
⁍ Multiple difficulty and comfort options
⁍ Hidden achievements and global leaderboards
⁍ Now Meta Quest 3 enhanced, featuring 2K native resolution.
⁍ Features enhanced immersion with native bHaptics support
⁍ Includes a dynamic high-speed soundtrack by Fat Bard

RUNNER version 1.431 update notes:
 --------------------------------------------- 
# Quest 3 enhancements enabled if you have a Quest 3. These include: 
- native 2,064 x 2,208 (2K) per eye render resolution for Quest 3 devices 
- increase to 90 hz refresh rate, which can be toggled
- increased color gamut to double Quest 2 for richer colors 
# Updated android framework to version 32 for increased stability and performance for all devices
# Modified encounters in stage 4 and 5 for a smoother difficulty transition
#Additional bug fixes and updates
#Shader recompile for improved stability and performance on Quest 2 and Quest 3

> Quest 3 enhancements enabled if you have a Quest 3! these include:

1.4.0 Update includes:

# Escape through the underground!
Our latest free content update, 1.4 now includes the new stage "The Underground," a winding subterranean waterway where preprocessed NEON ore is transported to the industrial district.  Weave through the darkened tunnel, fighting off submersible Cerberus units along the way.  Completing this stage also awards players a new secret achievement!

# Cruis'n N-351
Additional Cruise mode music has been added, featuring a collection of incredible ambient tracks by FAT BARD.  

# Take it Easy
Based on popular demand, we've now implemented an EASY mode for players who want a little more leeway without resorting to utilizing free play mode!  Easy mode reduces the amount of damage taken from enemies and collisions, but stops short of making players invincible.  All unlocks, leaderboards, and achievements are available in this mode!  Higher leaderboard scores are still possible when not utilizing the easy option, to provide players an additional challenge once they have their legs!

# Saber? I hardly knew her!
The Saber has been majorly upgraded, in terms of reach as well as damage.  Once only a specialty weapon, it now serves better in more scenarios as a close range weapon for players wanting to inject a little style into their action!

#Get some INTEL
HINTS and INTEL have been added to the main menu and Dead Drop scenes respectively! Hints provide a compendium of all the know enemy classes, while INTEL will provide players with key info on boss tactics and strategies, as well as hints for unlocking bikes!  This info is highlighted RED in the menu screens, so be sure to peruse it before continuing your run!

We have even more updates planned, so remember, if you like the game and want to see more, feel free to drop a rating and, if you have time, a review!

1.3.0 Update includes:

# Escape from Ferrous Factory # 7
Our second free update, Ferrous Factory #7 is a high security facility run by SHIN heavy industries. Escape the high security zone.  This bonus stage features a unique design with architectural features never before seen, accompanied by a special music track by James Roach.  Make it through the gauntlet, defeat the boss, and see if you can earn the new bonus achievement!

# Cruis'n N-351
Additional Cruise mode music has been added, featuring a collection of incredible ambient tracks by FAT BARD.  Cruise mode features alternative takes on several scenes, including the Citadel, to provide a unique tone to this experience so you can sit back, relax, and drive!

We have even more updates planned, so remember, if you like the game and want to see more, feel free to drop a rating and, if you have time, a review!

<RUNNER> v 1.1.6 "CheckPoint V.6" update
----------------------------------
-Checkpoints added! players will now have the option of restarting from a mid-stage checkpoint OR from the start of the boss battle, with full weapon upgrades retained. Choosing this option will incur a minor score penalty, however, though players will still have the option of restarting the stage the traditional way. (Gauntlet runs, such as stage 5 and stage 7, do not feature checkpoints due to their special encounter design). Hardcore players wanting to get an "S" rank will still be able to do so by ignoring the checkpoint option.

-We've decreased the score threshold for spawning the special hauler (shoot the lock on the back and collect the key to unlock a bike upon completing a stage without losing!). Additionally, an audio cue will play when the hauler is on the road!

-We've added additional hints to the restart menu should the player lose during a boss encounter.

-We've tweaked early boss encounters based on player feedback for a more gradual difficulty ramp. This was originally addressed in 1.1, and has been further adjusted in 1.1.2, and 1.1.4

-As of 1.1.6, we've added a save point for the final stage, so beating the final boss no longer requires clearing stage 6.

-Further texture and material improvements for architecture across the board.

-We've improved the balance of sidearm powerups.

-We've added an update bulletin to the title screen so you can see what's new at a glance.

-We've fixed a rare bug in the tutorial that prevented some players from advancing.

-We've improved our city engine rendering for later stages.

-We've added additional names to the credits sequence.

-We have fun DLC planned, but we want to ensure as perfect a base experience for players as possible first.

-We appreciate all the helpful and constructive feedback players have given us thus far! If you enjoy the game and want to see more, please feel free to drop a rating and, if you have time, a review!
